rev.comment: NPOV, google eco policy has nothing to do with 'global warming denial', so it really isn't appropiate to be there
rev.diff:
Line 70: Line 70:
==Environmental Record==
==Environmental Record==
â
In 2004, Google formed its for-profit philanthropic wing [[Google.org]], giving it a starting fund of $1 billion. The express mission of the organization is to help with the issues of [[climate change]] (see also [[global warming]] and [[climate change denial]]), global public health, and [[global poverty]]. Among its first projects is to develop a viable [[plug-in hybrid]] [[electric vehicle]] that can attain 100 [[fuel economy in automobiles|mpg]].<sup>[http://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/14/technology/14google.html]</sup>. The current director is Dr. [[Larry Brilliant]].<sup>[http://www.google.com/press/pressrel/brilliant.html]</sup>
+
In 2004, Google formed its for-profit philanthropic wing [[Google.org]], giving it a starting fund of $1 billion. The express mission of the organization is to help with the issues of [[climate change]] (see also [[global warming]]), global public health, and [[global poverty]]. Among its first projects is to develop a viable [[plug-in hybrid]] [[electric vehicle]] that can attain 100 [[fuel economy in automobiles|mpg]].<sup>[http://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/14/technology/14google.html]</sup>. The current director is Dr. [[Larry Brilliant]].<sup>[http://www.google.com/press/pressrel/brilliant.html]</sup>
